analyzed: jātaka  eka ka nipāta  para usa ta vagga
translated: The Jātaka🔽The Group of Discourses🔽The Chapter of the Higher Tetrad
“From four to eight, from eight to sixteen,🔽from sixteen to thirty-two,🔽from thirty-two to sixty-four,

original: aṭṭhāhipi ca soḷasa;🔽Soḷasāhi ca bāttiṁsa,🔽atricchaṁ cakkamāsado;
analyzed: ca soḷasa  soḍasāhi ca bāttisa  atriccham cakkam āsadaḥ
translated: the wheel has rolled on to thirty-six;
for the man who is struck by desire,
the wheel turns on his head.”
The Jātaka of Mittavindaka is the fourth.
